context: October 2015 marked a transformational moment when Dell announced its $67 billion acquisition of EMC Corporation, the largest technology sector acquisition in history at the time. Dell was the world's second-largest server vendor with robust storage, networking, and security businesses. The acquisition added EMC's storage market leadership and VMware's virtualization dominance. The deal positioned Dell to compete with Amazon Web Services in cloud computing and had ripple effects on HP and Cisco. HPE was founded in 2015 from HP's split.
